Interface Tree<V>

Type Parameters:
V - the type of vertices (nodes) * @author Silvere Martin-Michiellot
All Superinterfaces:
Graph<V>
All Known Implementing Classes:
RootedTree
public interface Tree<V> extends Graph<V>
Represents a tree data structure - a connected acyclic graph.

A tree is a graph where any two vertices are connected by exactly one path. This interface extends Graph to provide tree-specific operations such as root access, parent/child navigation, and depth calculations.

Tree structures are fundamental in many scientific domains:

  • Phylogenetics - evolutionary trees of species
  • Linguistics - parse trees, syntax trees
  • Computer science - decision trees, search trees
  • Mathematics - spanning trees, hierarchical structures

Since:
1.0
Author:
Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)
